Comment: Call this a conspiracy theory (which seems appropriate for any MTG story), but I think she's using all this "Primary" talk to get what she really wants: a place in the Trump cabinet.  She's been coveting one of those spots since his first term and hasn't been shy about it.  Time and time again she's been passed over.  So now she's essentially threatening to guarantee the Dem Senate seat for another 6 years or to flip Georgia's governorship blue for 4 - 8 years unless she's convinced not to run.    She wants something more than her little political district in rural Georgia.  She wants a true seat at the table.  This is her chance to get it; not with an election, but with the threat of ruining an election.  Again, just a conspiracy theory, but it seems to fit her standard operating mode.

This means that a significant portion of the population in Rome lives below the poverty line.¬†Here's a more detailed breakdown:  * **Poverty Rate:** Around 25.1% of Rome's population lived below the poverty line in one study, while [Data USA](https://datausa.io/profile/geo/rome-ga?redirect=true) reports 20.5%.¬†  * **Education:** Only 25.7% of the population had surpassed a high school diploma by 2020.¬† * **Income:** The average household income in Rome is $80,816.¬† * **Per Capita Income:** Rome's average per capita income is $37,805.¬† * **Median Household Income:** The median household income in Rome is $51,106.¬† * **Cost of Living:** Rome offers a lower cost of living compared to similarly sized metro areas.¬†  While Rome has a higher poverty rate, it also has a strong sense of community and a vibrant arts and historical scene. The city is also a regional center for education and medical care.¬†  What is the racial makeup of Rome, Georgia?The 5 largest ethnic groups in Rome, GA are White (Non-Hispanic) (48.9%), Black or African American (Non-Hispanic) (24.4%), Two+ (Hispanic) (6.85%), Other (Hispanic) (6.14%), and White (Hispanic) (5.84%).  Dalton, GA  Racial distribution of Dalton population: 55.78% are white, 5.32% are Black or African American, 4.37% are American Indian and Alaska Native, 2.49% are Asian, 0.05% are Native Hawaiian and other Pacific Islander, 20.41% are some other race and 11.59% are multiracial.  Dalton, GA has a total crime rate of 2,836 crimes per 100,000 people, which is higher than both the national average and the state average. Comment: Georgia isn‚Äôt likely to embrace Marjorie as a state. Kemp tried to move himself to the center when running for his second term and basically cut refund checks and gave bonuses to educators two years in a row to do it. The state, as a whole, leans conservative and still has traditional conservatives in the Atlanta Metro. For example: a Republican can never win Fulton Co but if they can keep Democrats under 70% there, they win.  DeKalb has a threshold of 80/20, Gwinnett recently flipped Blue in 2018 iirc, but Dems consistently win by 10ish. Keeping it around that number is necessary.  MTG only won her district, which is HEAVILY gerrymandered, by 90k votes. I‚Äôm not saying she can‚Äôt win, but I‚Äôd be surprised if the North Fulton County types actually vote for her. She would need huge support from the Northeastern and Southwestern blocs of the state.

They've controlled the house for almost 70% of the time since then and the senate for half the time since then.  They continued along the same trajectory to Trump, and have maintained the course of turning this country into a theocratic fascist hell hole through plague, and the country has rewarded them for it.   Normally, if someone fucks up, you demand they mend their ways. You don't just put them in a "timeout" for a few years.   Has Cheney left the GOP?  Has Romney?   Has anyone, really? Comment: I mean that the entire state votes for a states two US Senators. Only congressional districts vote for US Reps, and State Congress (both chambers). "Statewide officials" means that the entire state votes for them.   On the federal level, the whole state votes for the two US Senators, and the US President.   On the state level, the whole state votes for Governor, Lut. Governor, Secretary of State, Attorney General, as well as a few commissioners and other roles. ALL of those are Republican in Georgia right now, except for Ossoff and Warnock.   Make sense?

Comment: Of course the founding fathers were elite. They were coming off 800 years of monarchical rule.  However, with Washington's rejection of a military-supported monarchy, it was a step forward.  GW was a "small r" republican to his core.   I didn't say Nixon or Reagan were good Presidents or that they weren't conservatives.  Of course they were conservatives. I said they emerged from modest backgrounds, which is not consistent with your suggestion that the party was advocating for elites to rule.    MAGA has many bedfellows but one organizing principle: obstruct the left.  Trump garnered a lot of votes from working-class voters who are not advocates of the ruling elite.  Quite the opposite.  MAGA gained a lot of power by whipping up hysteria over elites ruling.    Trump has leveraged the hysteria and is creating a Putin-style patronage government.  That is most definitely a new development.  Spiro Agnew resigned the Vice Presidency over a $10k kickback.  Nixon was forced to resign for covering up Watergate.  Trump is more mafia boss than President.
